content: How can I help you today?

Well, my partner suggested I come here because I haven’t been sleeping well. Work has been so stressful, and I can’t stop worrying about getting fired, especially with everything going on in the economy. It’s gotten to the point where my mind races every night, and I just can’t seem to rest.
It sounds like things have been really tough with work stress and the economy weighing on you, and it's been affecting your sleep too. That sounds exhausting. How long has this been going on for you?

Honestly, it’s been going on for a couple of months now, but it’s gotten worse recently. I just can’t seem to shut my brain off at night, and everything feels like it’s piling up. It’s like I’m stuck in this cycle of stress and exhaustion.

It must be overwhelming to feel caught in that cycle of stress and exhaustion, especially when it’s been going on for months and seems to be getting worse. What’s been helping you so far, if anything, to manage these feelings or try to calm your mind?
To be honest, nothing’s really helping. I’ve tried watching TV, scrolling through my phone, even reading a book, but it doesn’t stop the thoughts. They just keep coming.

It sounds like you've tried different ways to distract yourself, but the thoughts keep pushing through, making it hard to feel at ease. That sounds really draining. What do you think is the hardest part about dealing with those racing thoughts or sleepless nights?

I think the hardest part is feeling like I’m failing. Like, if I lose my job, how am I supposed to take care of my family? It’s not just about me—I feel like everything is on the line, and I can’t let them down. That pressure just doesn’t go away.

It’s clear how deeply you care for your family and the responsibility you feel to support them. Carrying that weight and fearing failure sounds like it’s really fueling this stress for you. How do you want things to be different—for you and for your family—moving forward?

Honestly, I just want to feel like I have some control again—over my job, my sleep, my stress, everything. I want to be present for my partner and kids without this constant pressure hanging over me. I don’t know how to fix it, but I really want things to feel normal again.

Wanting to regain control and be fully present for your family sounds like such an important goal for you. That desire for normalcy and relief from all this pressure really shows how much you care about making things better. Is there anything else you’d like to share that you think connects to what’s been going on?

I guess I just feel stuck in this cycle. I want to do what’s best for my family, but I also feel like I’m failing them by not being able to handle all of this stress. It’s hard to shake off the fear of what might happen if I can’t keep it all together.

Feeling stuck and fearing you're not doing enough for your family sounds incredibly heavy to carry, especially when you're doing your best. It’s clear how much you care about them and want to provide for them, even though this pressure has been weighing you down. What do you think might help you take small steps toward breaking this cycle?

I’m honestly not sure what will help. I know I need to figure out a way to manage my stress and maybe find better ways to handle my worries, but I just don’t even know where to start. It feels like too much.

It’s understandable to feel unsure about where to begin when things feel overwhelming. Acknowledging the need for change is already a meaningful first step, especially with how much you’ve been dealing with. Would it be helpful to focus on one small area—like stress or sleep—where you might feel ready to explore some ways forward? Or is more time to reflect what you need right now?

It's hard to know where to begin when everything feels overwhelming—like there are just too many things to handle at once. Maybe we could start by talking through those worries in smaller pieces? That way, you don’t have to tackle it all at once, and we can see if there’s a manageable next step to give you some relief. What do you think?

Taking it one step at a time and breaking things into smaller pieces seems like a thoughtful way to start. Reflecting on those worries might make it easier to see where relief could begin. What’s one worry that feels easiest to share right now?

I think the biggest worry on my mind is losing my job. If that happens, I don’t know how I’ll support my family. It feels like everything depends on me keeping this job, and that’s such a huge weight to carry.

That concern about losing your job and how it would affect your family sounds overwhelming. Carrying the feeling that everything depends on you must be so emotionally draining. What might help ease the weight of that pressure, even a little?

I honestly don’t know; that’s part of what makes it so hard. The fear of not being able to provide is just always there in the back of my mind. I guess maybe if I felt more secure in my job, that might help. But I’m not sure how to get to that point.

Feeling more secure in your job could help ease that fear, but it sounds like you’re not sure what steps might help get you there. It’s completely okay to not have the answers right now—it’s a lot to think through. Would you like to explore ways to feel more grounded in yourself or your role, or would talking through how you cope with the stress make more sense right now?
